reviewText: Every song on this DVD belongs here.  There are no duds.  I especially like it because there is not another DVD or video that includes the songs listed here sung by The Fifth Dimension and Tony Orlando and Dawn.  There is a separate DVD of The Fifth Dimension but it is not worth buying if you want the hit songs.  I have purchased multiple copies of this DVD to use as prizes for my music students.  You will not go wrong in purchasing this DVD.  I have watched this DVD several times.  It is worth twice the price.
Title: N/A

reviewText: This DVD is just great!  The reunion of Tony Orlando and Dawn, for the first time in many years was heart-warming!  The best performance was delivered by B. J. Thomas.  He did three songs, and he sounds as good as he did 40 years ago!  Absolutely wonderful!  Also especially enjoyed Debby Boone doing "You Light up my Life".  She sang it beautifully and looked fantastic!  The 5th Dimension sang their two most popular songs, and although only two members were the original 5th Dimension, they did a terrific job, and it's the best 5th Dimension DVD on the market!  The only selection that wasn't up to par was The Association.  Their "Never My Love" was weak, and not the original performers, but it was still "watchable".  Strongly recommend this DVD!!
Title: N/A

reviewText: This was 60 minutes of pure fun. It was great to see artists who have rarely been seen on DVD (or virtually anywhere since their heyday). This is a good mix of 70's/60's Pop, R&B;, and Adult Contemporary. The pros far outweigh the cons of this production. Seeing an artist such as B.J.Thomas who had great success with multiple hits during that era sounded wonderful and is usually only seen on the small club circuit scene. Same could be said for Lou Rawls & Dionne Warwick (although they are on many other PBS/Concert reunion DVD's). The reunion of Tony Orlando & Dawn was a fun treat and Debbie Boone making an appearance to sing her huge 70's classic was a visual and listening pleasure.Groups that only partially have original members such as The 5th Dimension, The Association and Peaches & Herb sound good with replacement singers.I would rate this May 2003 recording the following way:Audio quality: 4.5 StarsVideo quality: 5 StarsActs/Performances: 4 StarsHas a strong line-up, some fun humor and good selection of material for each artist. Hope to see a Vol. 2.
Title: N/A

reviewText: It's a rare opportunity to watch Debby Boone perform "You Light Up My Life" in concert. She looks and sounds unchanged......what a miracle! I was quite shocked that Dionne had aged so much in this concert as she looks so much younger nowadays. Just bought a Tony Orlando & Dawn CD not long ago so I was shocked to see a much older & bloated Tony. B. J Thomas still looks good. This DVD is worth a buy to satisfy your curiosity.

reviewText: This was a PBS concert special which aired during a pledge drive, and although the lineup is perhaps not as stellar as one could have hoped for, it is still a wonderful musical experience, especially for one of my generation.  If you enjoy music primarily from the 70's, get this DVD.
summary: Another great nostalgia concert from American Soundtrack and PBS
